column3: sub-optimal? just call it incorrect :) `(hSocketMax > (SOCKET) -1)` is impossible to trigger.\n
It still needs the (SOCKET) cast to be portable to all platforms without warnings, I think\n
Yes, it still needs the (SOCKET) cast, otherwise you'll be comparing a signed against an unsigned value.\n

If you don't like the magic value make it compare against INVALID_SOCKET. After all, it is a socket number. SOCKET_ERROR is a _signed_ error value and is meant for comparing against wsaGetError() output.

You wanted to compare against both INVALID_SOCKET and SOCKET_ERROR which is the part I disagreed with.
